firemon_api.apps.securitymanager.devicegroups¶

class firemon_api.apps.securitymanager.devicegroups.DeviceGroup(config: dict, app: App)¶

Bases: Record

Device Group Record

Parameters:

  • config (dict) – dictionary of things values from json

  • app (obj) – App()

Examples

>>> dg = fm.sm.devicegroups.get("my group")
>>> dg.devices()
[<Device(F5-V13-1)>, <Device(NS-5XP)>, <Device(cp-r8030-fw-d1-2)>]

Returns:

bool

devices() → list[Device]¶

Get all devices assigned to device group

Returns:

list[Device]

rule_rec_devices(requirement: RuleRecRequirement, license_category: Literal['LOG_SERVERS', 'ROUTERS', 'OPERATING_SYSTEMS', 'FIREWALLS', 'FIREWALL_MANAGER_MODULES', 'EDGE_DEVICES', 'GENERIC_DEVICES', 'TRAFFIC_MANAGER_MODULES', 'UNKNOWN', 'SALES_ONLY_SMLO_HA', 'SALES_ONLY_SMSO_HA', 'SALES_ONLY_SMM_HA', 'POLICY_PLANNER', 'RISK', 'POLICY_OPTIMIZER', 'INSIGHT', 'GLOBAL_POLICY_CONTROLLER', 'AUTOMATION', 'LICENSE_NOT_REQUIRED'] | None = None, strategy: Literal['NAME_PATTERN', 'HITCOUNT', 'REFERENCES', 'NONE'] = 'NONE', force_tiebreak: bool | None = None, pattern: str | None = None, include_error_recs: bool | None = None) → list[Device]¶

Find devices in a Device Group that would have recommendable changes.

rule_rec_startingdevices(requirement: RuleRecRequirement, license_category: Literal['LOG_SERVERS', 'ROUTERS', 'OPERATING_SYSTEMS', 'FIREWALLS', 'FIREWALL_MANAGER_MODULES', 'EDGE_DEVICES', 'GENERIC_DEVICES', 'TRAFFIC_MANAGER_MODULES', 'UNKNOWN', 'SALES_ONLY_SMLO_HA', 'SALES_ONLY_SMSO_HA', 'SALES_ONLY_SMM_HA', 'POLICY_PLANNER', 'RISK', 'POLICY_OPTIMIZER', 'INSIGHT', 'GLOBAL_POLICY_CONTROLLER', 'AUTOMATION', 'LICENSE_NOT_REQUIRED'] | None = None) → list[Device]¶

Find devices in a Device Group that would have recommendable changes. Probably preferable to use rule_rec_devices()

class firemon_api.apps.securitymanager.devicegroups.DeviceGroups(api: ~firemon_api.core.api.FiremonAPI, app: ~firemon_api.core.app.App, record=<class 'firemon_api.apps.securitymanager.devicegroups.DeviceGroup'>)¶

Bases: Endpoint

Represents the Device Groups

Parameters:

  • api (obj) – FiremonAPI()

  • app (obj) – App()

Keyword Arguments:

record (obj) – default Record object

Examples

>>> cluster = fm.sm.devicegroups.get(name="my group")
>>> fm.sm.devicegroups.all()
ep_name = 'devicegroup'¶
get(*args, **kwargs) → DeviceGroup | None¶

Get single DeviceGroup

Parameters:

  • *args (int/str) – (optional) id or name to retrieve.

  • **kwargs (str) – (optional) see filter() for available filters

Examples

Get by ID

>>> fm.sm.devicegroupss.get(3)
>>> fm.sm.devicegroups.get("my group")
<DeviceGroup(my group)>

FireMon-API is a Python web wrapper for the FireMon SIP (Security Mangager, etc...) APIs. The intent is make something that is useful for quick and easy development against FireMon products.
